column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////I can't speak to the authenticity of the food
column3: particularly by the sausage-fried paella rice. Still reminiscing about the perfectly charred sausage bits. The poached egg on top makes it acceptable for breakfast
column5: makes the rice so creamy! We also ordered the pinxtos platter which was gorgeously presented on a wooden paddle
column6: and the buttermilk waffle with marcona almond
column7: nutella and bananas. You can definitely taste the salt in their french toast and waffles
column8: but the sweet syrup balances it out nicely.
